instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PP1V8_S0: What is PP1V8_S0? PP1V8_S0 is a power rail that is present when the machine is in an S0 state, meaning it is fully turned on, not sleeping or hiberating .
definitions.GPUVCORE_EN: What is GPUVCORE_EN? GPUVCORE_EN enables GPU VCORE when it is high, a power rail necessary for the GPU to function so you can get an image on the screen. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  Getting 19.90V Fans Spinning But not Posting
threads.message:
Working on a [URL="tel:<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>"]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>[/URL]-A <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> that is getting 19.90V on USB-C Meter and 1.2 amps...it has No Video either on Display Or External Display...You can hear the Charging sound whenever you plug in the Charger but No Video. Caps Lock reacts when fans are spinning but Not Posting. Here are some Measurments.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.57 Stable
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> = 3.3V Stable
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> = 5.1V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>=0.664V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0_GPU</SIGNAL> = 0.00V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S0</SIGNAL> = 1.79V
<SIGNAL>PPCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> = 0.663V
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S0_L</SIGNAL> = -0.000

Also Get these Readings...

RA900
Pin 1 - <SIGNAL>PPVIN_SOGPU_1V8_RC</SIGNAL> =12.56V
Pin 2 - <SIGNAL>PPBUS_HS_GPU</SIGNAL> =12.57

CA905 
Pin 1- <SIGNAL>PPVIN_SOGPU_1V8_RC</SIGNAL> =12.57V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  Getting 19.90V Fans Spinning But not Posting
threads.message:
Any history available, liquid signs?

Missing internal and external video at same time, could be <CHIP>U9800</CHIP> issue.
Video signals for internal LCD only pass through <CHIP>U9850</CHIP>, but backlight control is processed by <CHIP>U9800</CHIP>.
Could be even both chips affected...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  Getting 19.90V Fans Spinning But not Posting
threads.message: No Liquid Damage Or noticeable Physical Damage. Also No USB mouse light when plugged in, Just Caps Lock Light reaction when fans are spinning. Could it be the UA900 Chip Since RA900 has 12.7V on Pin 1 And Lin 2 instead of 1.8v that is supposed to be on pin as well as CA905?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  Getting 19.90V Fans Spinning But not Posting
threads.message:
Wrong assumption!
That is the power input (from PPBUS) for the <SIGNAL>1V8_GPU</SIGNAL> power supply.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  Getting 19.90V Fans Spinning But not Posting
threads.message: Okay...The only reason I asked is because the <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S0GPU_1V8_RC</SIGNAL> is Reading 12.7V on RA900 and CA905...So what could be causing the Improper Voltage on that Resistor and Cap?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  Getting 19.90V Fans Spinning But not Posting
threads.message:
Again... WRONG ASSUMPTION!!!!!!
That voltage is correct.
Don't you see RA900 is connected to PPBUS???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  Getting 19.90V Fans Spinning But not Posting
threads.message: Hmmmmm...According to the Schematics <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S0GPU_1V8_RC</SIGNAL> Should be on Pin 1 of RA900 shouldn?t that be 1.8V and not the 12.57 that I?m getting on both Pin 1 And Pin2?   I?m Confused as All Hell now...lol...I?m NOT Saying your Wrong by ANY means I?m just trying to learn :-)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  Getting 19.90V Fans Spinning But not Posting
threads.message: Also The CPU Gets warm But the GPU is cold...like it?s not powering on at all...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  Getting 19.90V Fans Spinning But not Posting
threads.message: Anybody have any Ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  Getting 19.90V Fans Spinning But not Posting
threads.message:
Let see...
What voltage do you expect on <SIGNAL>P1V8GPU_EN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>REG_SSTR_P1V8GPU</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>REG_PHASE_1V8GPU</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>REG_VOS_P1V8GPU</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>REG_FB_P1V8GPU</SIGNAL>???
All have "1V8" in the name...

Do you also expect 1.8V at <SIGNAL>AGND_P1V8GPU</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  Getting 19.90V Fans Spinning But not Posting
threads.message: I Apologize if I upset you in anyway 2informaticos as I am just trying to get better at this, and I DO appreciate your expertise as I am Learning...what do you recommend I try ? Thank You for your Patience due to my ignorance and Thank You for Taking the time to help Me...Please let me know :)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  Getting 19.90V Fans Spinning But not Posting
threads.message:
You didn't upset me.
I just tried to explain you that 1V8 in the name doesn't imply 1.8V in that line.
Some are signals, other voltages, or feedback, which all reffer to 1V8 power supply.
You can see that all the power supplies have a particular "voltage refference" in the name of their lines.
So, be aware, do not assume things so easy.
This can block you in the way of a repair process.

Do you get voltage at GPU coils at least (LA640/50)?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  Getting 19.90V Fans Spinning But not Posting
threads.message: I?ll check when I get home this evening...And Again Thank You for Your Help I Really appreciate it

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  Getting 19.90V Fans Spinning But not Posting
threads.message: Hi 2informaticos, I checked the Voltage on LA640/50 and I get 0.000V in all 4 Pins.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  Getting 19.90V Fans Spinning But not Posting
threads.message:
Good enough to check one pin only for a coil.
Post diode mode reading to ground now (red probe at ground).
If very low value, switch to ohm mode.

Check power rails and enable signal for UA600.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  Getting 19.90V Fans Spinning But not Posting
threads.message:
Hi 2informaticos, Here are the Measurements you asked me to take....

LA640/50 Diode Mode

LA640 Pin 1  1.5  Ohms
LA650 Pin 1  1.2 Ohms

UA600 


Pin 35 <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S0_GFXIMVP_VIN</SIGNAL> 12.57V
PIN 29 PP5V_S0_GFXIMVP_ VDD 5.1V
Pin 7 <SIGNAL>PP1V8_S0_GPU</SIGNAL> -0.00V
PIN 30 <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_GFXIMVP_VDD</SIGNAL> 5.1V



RA012 Pin 2 <SIGNAL>GPUVCORE_EN</SIGNAL>  0.000V
<RESISTOR>R9824</RESISTOR>  Pin 1  <SIGNAL>EG_RAIL4_EN</SIGNAL>  -0.000V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  Getting 19.90V Fans Spinning But not Posting
threads.message:
You should get P3V3GPU and P1V8GPU before GPUVCORE.
So check their power supplies.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  Getting 19.90V Fans Spinning But not Posting
threads.message:

CA950 Pin1  <SIGNAL>P3V3GPU_RAMP</SIGNAL>   0.000V
RA010  Pin2  <SIGNAL>P3V3_GPU_EN</SIGNAL>  0.000V
